intro: Drymonia rhodoloma, commonly known as the red-flowered drymonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, pink to red blooms. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full shade, making it a suitable ornamental for woodland gardens. Its small, leathery leaves and clustered flowers contribute to its ornamental value, while its ability to tolerate moist conditions adds to its versatility in landscaping.
